Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pushing in afterEach doesn't call afterEach again." (#1928) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using the .afterEach hook in my routing.
In this hook, i'm changing the pagetitle and also validating some logic.

In some cases the user have to be redirected, so I'm using push() to relocate the browser.
The problem is, that after the routing has been complete, the afterEach doesn't get called again, so my pagetitle isn't updated correctly...

Is this for a reason, or is it a bug?
Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "provide option to disable url encoding when use Named Routes" (#1909) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
i use name Named Routes to pass property.

i wrote router configuration like below

```javascript
{path: '/myapp/workspace/:namespace/actions/:name*', component: ActionDetail , props : true , name:'actionDetail'},
```

and push in my vue file like below

```javascript
this.$router.push({name: 'actionDetail', params: {'name': action.name ,  'action': {id:'test'}}});
```

it is work perfectly. But when i pass value include "/" chracter(like class/music),

then browser url is changed include "%2F" instead of "/".

so, i reload my page then can't load.(if i use "/" instead of "%2F" , there was nothing problem)

i think vue router has option, disable url encoding.

thank you.

### What does the proposed API look like?
i hope some option like below are provided

```javascript
this.$router.push({name: 'actionDetail', params: {'name': action.name ,  'action': updateAction} ,url-encoding:false });
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "this.$router in setTimeout doesn't work" (#1927) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/mu6f7zj6/](https://jsfiddle.net/mu6f7zj6/)

### Steps to reproduce
click Go to Foo , and console said Cannot read property 'push' of undefined.

### What is expected?
1s after clicked Go to Foo should redirect to '/' (home), and 'foo' should disapear

### What is actually happening?
Cannot read property 'push' of undefined.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Inject store module into component instead of full store" (#1081) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I'm developing a component that requires Vuex, but may be be distributed across several applications, so i don't know in advance where exactly component state will be managed - will it be `this.$store` itself or something like `this.$store.somePage.specificComponent`. I don't want to pass store as prop, so, ideally, i would like to let end user to set specific store module when he or she instantiates my component.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```html
<!-- this passes $store as usual -->
<my-component />
<!-- this passes $store.somePage.specificComponent as $store for my-component -->
<my-component v-store="somePage.specificComponent" />
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
